inputFields.name: delivery
inputFields.description: Collected PII is processed even with no opt-in

inputFields.name: extraSupporters
inputFields.description: Extra supporter count. If you want to add a number of signatories you have offline or kept in another system, you can specify the number here.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description:
Unique NAME identifying ActionPage.

Does not have to exist, must be unique. Can be a 'technical' identifier
scoped to particular organization, so it does not have to change when the
slugs/names change (eg. some.org/1234). However, frontend Widget can
ask for ActionPage by it's current location.href (but without https://), in which case it is useful
to make this url match the real widget location.

inputFields.name: supporterConfirmTemplate
inputFields.description: Supporter confirm email template of this ActionPage

inputFields.name: thankYouTemplate
inputFields.description: Thank you email template of this ActionPage

enumValues.name: ACTIVE
enumValues.description: This action page received actions lately

enumValues.name: STALLED
enumValues.description: This action page did not receive actions lately

enumValues.name: STANDBY
enumValues.description: This action page is ready to receive first action or is stalled for over 1 year

fields.name: actions
fields.description:
Fetch public actions. Can be used to display recent comments for example.

To allow-list action fields to be public, `campaign.public_actions` must be set to a list of strings in form
action_type:custom_field_name, eg: `["signature:comment"]`. XXX this cannot be set in API, you need to set in backend.

args.name: limit
args.description: Limit the number of returned actions, default is 10, max is 100)

inputFields.description: Campaign external_id. If provided, it will be used to find campaign. Can be used to rename a campaign

fields.name: endAt
fields.description: This is last day and end hour of the campaign. Note, every day of the campaign the end hour will be same.

fields.name: messageTemplate
fields.description:
If email templates are used to create MTT, use this template (works like thank you email templates).
Otherwise, the raw text that is send with MTT action will make a plain text email.

fields.name: startAt
fields.description: This is first day and start hour of the campaign. Note, every day of the campaign the start hour will be same.

fields.name: testEmail
fields.description: A test target email (yourself) where test mtt actions will be sent (instead to real targets)

inputFields.name: transient
inputFields.description: Unused. To mark action_type/key as transient, use campaign.transient_actions list

types.name: Date
types.description:
The `Date` scalar type represents a date. The Date appears in a JSON
response as an ISO8601 formatted string, without a time component.

types.name: DateTime
types.description:
The `DateTime` scalar type represents a date and time in the UTC
timezone. The DateTime appears in a JSON response as an ISO8601 formatted
string, including UTC timezone ("Z"). The parsed date and time string will
be converted to UTC if there is an offset.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: Provide amount of this donation, in smallest units for currency

fields.name: currency
fields.description: Provide currency of this donation

fields.name: frequencyUnit
fields.description: Donation frequency unit

fields.name: payload
fields.description: Donation data

inputFields.name: amount
inputFields.description: Provide amount of this donation, in smallest units for currency

inputFields.name: frequencyUnit
inputFields.description: How often is the recurring donation collected

inputFields.name: schema
inputFields.description: Provide payload schema to validate, eg. stripe_payment_intent

enumValues.name: ACTIVE
enumValues.description: This email was contacted before

enumValues.name: BLOCKED
enumValues.description: This email was used and blocked

enumValues.name: BOUNCE
enumValues.description: This email was used and bounced

enumValues.name: DOUBLE_OPT_IN
enumValues.description: The user has received a DOI on this email and accepted it

enumValues.name: INACTIVE
enumValues.description: This email was disabled and should not be contacted

enumValues.name: NONE
enumValues.description: An unused email

enumValues.name: SPAM
enumValues.description: This email was used and marked spam

enumValues.name: UNSUB
enumValues.description: This email was used and user unsubscribed

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

args.name: input
args.description: Contet of the org to be added

fields.name: addOrgUser
fields.description: Add user to org by email

fields.name: addStripeObject
fields.description:
Create stripe object using Stripe key associated with action page owning org.
Pass any of paymentIntent, subscription, customer, price json params to be sent as-is to Stripe API. The result is a JSON returned by Stripe API or a GraphQL Error object.
If you provide customer along payment intent or subscription, it will be first created, then their id will be added to params for the payment intent or subscription, so you can pack 2 Stripe API calls into one. You can do the same with price object in case of a subscription.

args.name: paymentIntent
args.description: Parameters for Stripe Payment Intent creation

fields.name: addStripePaymentIntent
fields.description: Stripe API - add a stripe payment intent, when donating to the action page specified by id

fields.name: addStripeSubscription
fields.description: Stripe API - add a stripe subscription, when donating to the action page specified by id

fields.name: copyActionPage
fields.description:
Adds a new Action Page based on another Action Page. Intended to be used to
create a partner action page based off lead's one. Copies: campaign, locale, config, delivery flag

args.name: fromName
args.description: Name of Action Page this one is cloned from

args.name: orgName
args.description: Org owner of new Action Page

fields.name: copyCampaignActionPage
fields.description:
Adds a new Action Page based on latest Action Page from campaign. Intended to be used to
create a partner action page based off lead's one. Copies: campaign, locale, config, delivery flag

args.name: fromCampaignName
args.description: Name of Campaign from which the page is copied

args.name: orgName
args.description: Org owner of new Action Page

Delete a campaign.
Deletion will be blocked if there are action pages with personal data (we never remove personal data unless via GDPR).

fields.name: updateUser
fields.description: Update (current) user details

args.name: email
args.description: Admin can use user email to specify user to update

args.name: id

args.name: input
args.description: Input values to update in user

fields.name: upsertCampaign
fields.description:
Upserts a campaign.

Creates or appends campaign and it's action pages. In case of append, it
will change the campaign with the matching name, and action pages with
matching names. It will create new action pages if you pass new names. No
Action Pages will be removed (principle of not removing signature data).

fields.name: upsertService
fields.description: Insert or update a service for an org, using id to to update a particular one

args.name: id
args.description: Id to select service to be updated

fields.name: upsertTargets
fields.description:
Upsert multiple targets at once.
external_id is used to decide if new target record is added, or existing one is updated.

args.name: campaignId
args.description: Id of campaign these targets are added to

args.name: outdatedTargets
args.description: Action to perform on targets missing in targets list

fields.name: upsertTemplate
fields.description:
Upsert an email tempalte to be used for sending various emails.
It belongs to org and is identified by (name, locale), so you can have multiple "thank_you" templates for different languages.

args.name: orgName
args.description: Add email tempalte to which org

fields.name: actionPage
fields.description:
Get action page.
Depending on your access (page owner, lead, instance admin),
you will get private or public view of the page.

args.name: name
args.description: Get action page by name the widget is displayed on

args.name: url
args.description: Get action page by url the widget is displayed on (DEPRECATED, use name)

fields.name: application
fields.description: Get application info

fields.name: campaign
fields.description:
Get one campaign. If you have access to the campaign, as lead or
partner, you will get a private view of the campaign, otherwise, a public
view.

fields.name: campaigns
fields.description: Returns a public list of campaigns, filtered by title. Can be used to implement a campaign search box on a website.

args.name: id
args.description: DEPRECATED: use campaign() to get one campaign. Select by id, Returns list of 1 result

args.name: name
args.description: DEPRECATED: use campaign() to get one campaign. Filter campaigns by name (exact match). If found, returns list of 1 campaign, otherwise an empty list

args.name: title
args.description: Filter campaigns by title using LIKE format (% means any sequence of characters)

fields.name: currentUser
fields.description: Get the current user, as determined by Authorization header

fields.name: exportActions
fields.description: Export actions collected by org, optionally filtered by campaign

args.name: after
args.description: return only actions created at date time from this argument (inclusive)

args.name: limit
args.description: Limit the number of returned actions

args.name: onlyDoubleOptIn
args.description: Only download double opted in contacts

args.name: onlyOptIn
args.description: Only download opted in contacts and actions (default true)

args.name: start
args.description: return only actions with id starting from this argument (inclusive)

fields.name: users
fields.description: Select users from this instnace. Requires a manage users admin permission.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByUrl`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.
